title: Build Vertical Slice
purpose: Describe the core function Build Vertical Slice.
guardrails: Keep the vertical slice strictly scoped; do not add unapproved features or levels
Align UI designs with established art and UX guidelines to ensure consistency
Do not attempt to implement the full game; only include features necessary for the demonstration
Ensure accessibility features such as color contrast and scalable text are implemented where applicable
Limit playtesting participants to internal or NDA‑bound testers; no public release
Track and meet performance metrics; avoid sacrificing stability for visual polish
Document known issues, limitations, and workarounds clearly in the handoff materials
Seek approval before sharing the vertical slice outside the project team

tasks.title: Define vertical slice scope, goals, and performance targets.
tasks.description: Set the scope and goals of the vertical slice and define performance targets for the demonstration.

deliverables.description: Document detailing the scope, goals, features, scenes, and performance targets (FPS, resolution, load times) for the vertical slice agreed upon by stakeholders.

acceptance.text: Lists all features and scenes included in the vertical slice.
Defines performance targets such as FPS and load times for target hardware.
Signed by stakeholders.

tasks.title: Design and implement UI (mockups, HUD, integrated components).
tasks.description: Design and implement user interface components, including mockups and an integrated module ready for the vertical slice.

deliverables.description: High-fidelity mockups of user interface screens and HUD elements for the vertical slice.

acceptance.text: Mockups adhere to established UX and art guidelines.
Covers all UI screens required for the slice.
Approved by UX designer and art director.

deliverables.description: Integrated UI module containing implemented UI elements ready for the vertical slice build.

acceptance.text: UI components compile and function correctly within the engine.
Matches the design specified in mockups.
Tested for responsiveness and scalability.

tasks.title: Integrate narrative cutscenes/cinematics and polish presentation elements.
tasks.description: Integrate narrative cutscenes and polish presentation elements, culminating in a demo video of the vertical slice.

deliverables.description: Asset package containing visual and audio assets for narrative cutscenes and cinematics used in the vertical slice.

acceptance.text: Assets include animations, backgrounds, character art, and audio.
All assets sync properly with cutscene scripts.
Reviewed by narrative and animation leads.

deliverables.description: Markdown scripts detailing timing, dialogue, and triggers for each cutscene.

acceptance.text: Scripts outline timing, triggers, and dialogue for each cutscene.
Scripts align with game narrative and design.
Reviewed and approved by narrative designer.

deliverables.description: Polished demonstration video showcasing the vertical slice, including cutscenes, gameplay, and UI flow.

acceptance.text: Video captures the full vertical slice with high-quality visuals and audio.
Includes cutscenes, gameplay, and UI interactions.
Used for internal and external presentations.

tasks.title: Optimize performance for target hardware and document results.
tasks.description: Optimize the vertical slice for target hardware and document the results in a performance report.

deliverables.description: Report detailing performance metrics (FPS, load times, memory usage) for the vertical slice across all target hardware with optimization steps and results.

acceptance.text: Provides performance data for each target platform.
Shows optimization steps and resulting improvements.
Confirms targets have been met or highlights shortfalls with plans.

tasks.title: Conduct user playtests, analyze feedback, and iterate slice.
tasks.description: Run user playtests on the vertical slice, analyze feedback, and iterate on the build to address issues.

deliverables.description: Report summarizing findings from user playtests, including quantitative metrics and qualitative feedback, along with recommended improvements.

acceptance.text: Includes data from at least five playtesters.
Summarizes issues and suggestions, prioritizes critical issues.
Recommends improvements and actions for next iteration.

deliverables.description: Updated build of the vertical slice reflecting changes and fixes based on playtest feedback.

acceptance.text: Implements improvements addressing at least 80% of critical issues identified.
Build runs without new critical defects.
Ready for another test or sign-off.

tasks.title: Compile UI asset pack and documentation for distribution.
tasks.description: Prepare a distributable UI asset pack along with documentation for use in subsequent development phases.

deliverables.description: Packaged collection of UI assets (textures, prefabs, scripts) ready for distribution and integration into future builds.

acceptance.text: Contains all finalized UI assets used in the vertical slice.
Organized in a clean folder structure with names and versioning.
Ready for integration into downstream development.

deliverables.description: Documentation describing the UI assets, usage instructions, and integration guidelines.

acceptance.text: Documents each UI asset and its intended usage.
Provides instructions for import and integration.
Reviewed by UI engineer and designer.

tasks.title: Finalize vertical slice build and handoff materials.
tasks.description: Deliver the finalized vertical slice build along with handoff documentation and a known issues list.

deliverables.description: Final build of the vertical slice complete with all polished features, optimized performance, and fixed issues ready for handoff.

acceptance.text: Build passes QA with no critical or blocking defects.
Implements all scoped features and content.
Tagged and archived in version control.

deliverables.description: Comprehensive documentation for the final vertical slice build including installation instructions, known issues, and points of contact.

acceptance.text: Documents installation/setup, features included, known issues, and points of contact.
Clear and formatted for handoff to downstream teams.
Reviewed and approved by leads.

deliverables.description: List of minor known issues and workarounds for the final vertical slice build.

acceptance.text: Lists known issues with severity and suggested workarounds.
No critical or high-severity issues remain.
Published alongside final build.
